oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mid-state business women meet here, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A captioned photo from the Nashville Times (1940), about a semi-annual meeting of the Middle Tennessee District of the Tennessee Federation of Business and Professional Women’s Clubs. They gathered in Nashville and “among those at the speakers’ table were, left to right, above: Miss Sallie Duncan, Nashville; Miss Carolyn Akin, Franklin; Miss Mildred Hearne, Lebanon; Mrs. Edna Uffelmann, Clarksville; Mrs. Amelia Copenhaver, Bristol, president of the state organization; Mrs. Virginia MacKenzie Ritter, Nashville, director of the Middle Tennessee District; Mrs. Lula Holladay, Cookeville, first vice-president; Mrs. Gladys Bragg, Murfreesboro; Miss Mary Spiva Beasley, Nashville; Miss Olivia Short, Clarksville.” Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Tennessee Federation of Business and Professional Women’s Clubs
